text:
Mandarin Oriental, Singapore Gears Up For Race Season Published on : Tuesday, September 1, 2015
Stunningly located right in front of Marina Bay circuit turns 16 and 17, Mandarin Oriental, Singapore offers an unrivalled vantage point for race enthusiasts to be part of the adrenaline-charged action with a winning formula of food and drinks from 18 to 20 September 2015.
Set directly next to the street circuit, Axis Bar and Lounge will be transformed into a
beautiful and luxurious Oyster and Champagne Bar, where guests can indulge in an unlimited flow of premium oysters, champagne, miniature desserts, and Beluga Caviar canapés. Priced at SGD 350 per person on 18 and 19 September and SGD 550 per person on 20 September, guests can also be kept entertained with live music performances from 8.00pm to 11.45pm.
Make a pitstop and fuel up in 60 minutes or less at MELT ~ The World Café, offering a
resplendent spread of eclectic International and Asian cuisines. Relish in Asian delights and
European classics, including the much loved Indian cuisine counter, BBQ alfresco terrace, as well as the live dessert station. Priced at SGD 45 per person on 19 and 20 September, the Pitstop Lunch Buffet is available for 45 minutes; whereas the Pitstop Dinner Buffet is
available for 60 minutes and priced at SGD 60 from 18 to 20 September. Regular buffet
prices and timings are also available.
Dolce Vita flags off the race season with sensational Italian culinary creations, created by
Chef de Cuisine Omar Bernardi, along with the whizzing sounds of roaring engines for the
annual grid event. A special four-course set dinner is priced at SGD 128 on 18 and 20
September, and daily supper service at Dolce Vita and BAY@5 is available till 2.30am.
Grab pole position on race weekend and lap up delectable seafood delicacies and tantalising
meats for a boost of delicious Cantonese flavours, while catching a piece of the heart-
pumping race adventure on television screens placed strategically within the restaurant.
Source:- Mandarin Oriental
